oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Richard B. Loomis describing Battle of Fort Sanders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Loomis served in Co. H, 21st Mass. Inf. Regt., USA. He wrote from Knoxville to his brother Austin describing Longstreet's seige of the town and the assault on Fort Sanders on Nov. 29, 1863. He describes in great detail his unit's 3-month campaign in East Tennessee as part of Gen. Burnside's army and gives a vivid account of Gen. James Longstreet's 19-day seige of Knoxville and his ill-fated attack on the salient at Fort Sanders. As he writes, they are in pursuit of Longstreet's Confederates.
